result.execSummary:
The defendant Veronica Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

defendant.name: Rodriguez, Veronica

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Veronica Rodriguez not in court. Account Clerk appears for Dodge County. Accout clerk heard on status of matter, one payment was made of $25 in July, request that this be turned over to the State Debt Collection and that a civil judgment be entered. Court heard, so ordered.
Payment hearing on December 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Payment plan granted in the amount of $25.00 per month commencing on 6/15/16  until paid in full
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Veronica Rodriguez in court with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Shelton heard, requesting a plea and sentencing date, court schedules, removes trial date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $40.00 prior to release.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:44) Defendant Veronica Rodriguez in custody via video with attorney Ramneek Singh Button (will appoint).  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Button heard on Def.'s FTA at RD; State requests cash; Atty. Button response; Court sets $500.00 PA Bond with conditions: prior conditions; $40 warrant fees due prior to release; RD 4/14/16 at 3:45pm and JT remains 4/20/16 at 8:30am in Br. 1
Def. FTA for Return Date (1:42); State appears by Yolanda Tienstra; Court authorizes warrant, revokes bond; JT shall remain at this time
Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:07 - Defendant, Veronica Rodriguez in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Return date scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
